verses.kjv: At the same time came the disciples unto Jesus, saying, Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?
verses.web: In that hour the disciples came to Jesus, saying, “Who then is greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven?”
verses.ct: Around that time, the disciples came to Jesus and asked, "Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus called a little child unto him, and set him in the midst of them,
verses.web: Jesus called a little child to himself, and set him in the middle of them,
verses.ct: Jesus called a little child over and had him stand right in the middle of the group.

verses.kjv: And said, Verily I say unto you, Except ye be converted, and become as little children, ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven.
verses.web: and said, “Most certainly I tell you, unless you turn, and become as little children, you will in no way enter into the Kingdom of Heaven.
verses.ct: Then he said, "I tell you the truth: unless you change and become like little children, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.

verses.kjv: Whosoever therefore shall humble himself as this little child, the same is greatest in the kingdom of heaven.
verses.web: Whoever therefore humbles himself as this little child is the greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven.
verses.ct: Whoever humbles himself like this child — that person is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.

verses.kjv: And whoso shall receive one such little child in my name receiveth me.
verses.web: Whoever receives one such little child in my name receives me,
verses.ct: And whoever welcomes a child like this in my name is welcoming me.

verses.kjv: But whoso shall offend one of these little ones which believe in me, it were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and that he were drowned in the depth of the sea.
verses.web: but whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble, it would be better for him if a huge millstone were hung around his neck, and that he were sunk in the depths of the sea.
verses.ct: But if anyone causes one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble, it would be better for that person to have a huge millstone hung around his neck and be drowned in the depths of the sea.

verses.kjv: Woe unto the world because of offences! for it must needs be that offences come; but woe to that man by whom the offence cometh!
verses.web: “Woe to the world because of occasions of stumbling! For it must be that the occasions come, but woe to that person through whom the occasion comes!
verses.ct: How terrible for the world because of the things that cause people to stumble! Those things are bound to happen, but how terrible for the person who brings them about!

verses.kjv: Wherefore if thy hand or thy foot offend thee, cut them off, and cast them from thee: it is better for thee to enter into life halt or maimed, rather than having two hands or two feet to be cast into everlasting fire.
verses.web: If your hand or your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off, and cast it from you. It is better for you to enter into life maimed or crippled, rather than having two hands or two feet to be cast into the eternal fire.
verses.ct: If your hand or your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off and throw it away. It's better to enter life crippled or maimed than to have both hands and both feet and be thrown into everlasting fire.

verses.kjv: And if thine eye offend thee, pluck it out, and cast it from thee: it is better for thee to enter into life with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire.
verses.web: If your eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out, and cast it from you. It is better for you to enter into life with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into the Gehenna of fire.
verses.ct: If your eye causes you to stumble, tear it out and throw it away. It's better to enter life with one eye than to have both eyes and be thrown into the fire of hell.

verses.kjv: Take heed that ye despise not one of these little ones; for I say unto you, That in heaven their angels do always behold the face of my Father which is in heaven.
verses.web: See that you don’t despise one of these little ones, for I tell you that in heaven their angels always see the face of my Father who is in heaven.
verses.ct: Be careful not to look down on any of these little ones. I'm telling you, their angels in heaven are always in the presence of my Father in heaven.

verses.kjv: For the Son of man is come to save that which was lost.
verses.web: For the Son of Man came to save that which was lost.
verses.ct: The Son of Man came to save those who are lost.

verses.kjv: How think ye? if a man have an hundred sheep, and one of them be gone astray, doth he not leave the ninety and nine, and goeth into the mountains, and seeketh that which is gone astray?
verses.web: “What do you think? If a man has one hundred sheep, and one of them goes astray, doesn’t he leave the ninety-nine, go to the mountains, and seek that which has gone astray?
verses.ct: What do you think? If a man owns 100 sheep and one of them wanders off, won't he leave the 99 on the hills and go searching for the one that strayed?

verses.kjv: And if so be that he find it, verily I say unto you, he rejoiceth more of that sheep, than of the ninety and nine which went not astray.
verses.web: If he finds it, most certainly I tell you, he rejoices over it more than over the ninety-nine which have not gone astray.
verses.ct: I tell you the truth: if he finds it, he's happier about that one sheep than about the 99 that never wandered off.

verses.kjv: Even so it is not the will of your Father which is in heaven, that one of these little ones should perish.
verses.web: Even so it is not the will of your Father who is in heaven that one of these little ones should perish.
verses.ct: In the same way, your Father in heaven doesn't want even one of these little ones to be lost.

verses.kjv: Moreover if thy brother shall trespass against thee, go and tell him his fault between thee and him alone: if he shall hear thee, thou hast gained thy brother.
verses.web: “If your brother sins against you, go, show him his fault between you and him alone. If he listens to you, you have gained back your brother.
verses.ct: If your brother sins against you, go and talk to him privately, just the two of you. If he listens, you've won your brother back.

verses.kjv: But if he will not hear thee, then take with thee one or two more, that in the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established.
verses.web: But if he doesn’t listen, take one or two more with you, that at the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established.
verses.ct: But if he won't listen, bring 1 or 2 others along, so that every accusation can be confirmed by 2 or 3 witnesses.

verses.kjv: And if he shall neglect to hear them, tell it unto the church: but if he neglect to hear the church, let him be unto thee as an heathen man and a publican.
verses.web: If he refuses to listen to them, tell it to the assembly. If he refuses to hear the assembly also, let him be to you as a Gentile or a tax collector.
verses.ct: If he refuses to listen to them, bring the matter before the church. And if he refuses to listen even to the church, treat him as you would a Gentile or a tax collector.

verses.kjv: Verily I say unto you, Whatsoever ye shall bind on earth shall be bound in heaven: and whatsoever ye shall loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.
verses.web: Most certainly I tell you, whatever things you bind on earth will have been bound in heaven, and whatever things you release on earth will have been released in heaven.
verses.ct: I tell you the truth: whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you release on earth will be released in heaven.

verses.kjv: Again I say unto you, That if two of you shall agree on earth as touching any thing that they shall ask, it shall be done for them of my Father which is in heaven.
verses.web: Again, assuredly I tell you, that if two of you will agree on earth concerning anything that they will ask, it will be done for them by my Father who is in heaven.
verses.ct: I also tell you this: if 2 of you on earth agree together about anything you pray for, my Father in heaven will do it for you.

verses.kjv: For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I in the midst of them.
verses.web: For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there I am in the middle of them.”
verses.ct: Because wherever 2 or 3 gather together in my name, I am right there with them."

verses.kjv: Then came Peter to him, and said, Lord, how oft shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? till seven times?
verses.web: Then Peter came and said to him, “Lord, how often shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? Until seven times?”
verses.ct: Then Peter came to him and asked, "Lord, how many times should I forgive my brother when he sins against me? Up to 7 times?"

verses.kjv: Jesus saith unto him, I say not unto thee, Until seven times: but, Until seventy times seven.
verses.web: Jesus said to him, “I don’t tell you until seven times, but, until seventy times seven.
verses.ct: Jesus answered, "Not 7 times — but 70 times 7.

verses.kjv: Therefore is the kingdom of heaven likened unto a certain king, which would take account of his servants.
verses.web: Therefore the Kingdom of Heaven is like a certain king, who wanted to reconcile accounts with his servants.
verses.ct: That's why the kingdom of heaven is like a king who decided to settle accounts with his servants.

verses.kjv: And when he had begun to reckon, one was brought unto him, which owed him ten thousand talents.
verses.web: When he had begun to reconcile, one was brought to him who owed him ten thousand talents.
verses.ct: As he began going through the records, a man was brought before him who owed him 10,000 talents.

verses.kjv: But forasmuch as he had not to pay, his lord commanded him to be sold, and his wife, and children, and all that he had, and payment to be made.
verses.web: But because he couldn’t pay, his lord commanded him to be sold, with his wife, his children, and all that he had, and payment to be made.
verses.ct: Since the man couldn't pay, the king ordered that he, his wife, his children, and everything he owned be sold to cover the debt.

verses.kjv: The servant therefore fell down, and worshipped him, saying, Lord, have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.
verses.web: The servant therefore fell down and knelt before him, saying, ‘Lord, have patience with me, and I will repay you all!’
verses.ct: The servant dropped to his knees and begged, 'Please, be patient with me! I'll pay back every bit of it!'

verses.kjv: Then the lord of that servant was moved with compassion, and loosed him, and forgave him the debt.
verses.web: The lord of that servant, being moved with compassion, released him, and forgave him the debt.
verses.ct: The king's heart was filled with compassion. He released the man and forgave the entire debt.

verses.kjv: But the same servant went out, and found one of his fellowservants, which owed him an hundred pence: and he laid hands on him, and took him by the throat, saying, Pay me that thou owest.
verses.web: “But that servant went out, and found one of his fellow servants, who owed him one hundred denarii, and he grabbed him, and took him by the throat, saying, ‘Pay me what you owe!’
verses.ct: But that same servant went out and found a fellow servant who owed him 100 denarii. He grabbed him by the throat and demanded, 'Pay me what you owe!'

verses.kjv: And his fellowservant fell down at his feet, and besought him, saying, Have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.
verses.web: “So his fellow servant fell down at his feet and begged him, saying, ‘Have patience with me, and I will repay you!’
verses.ct: His fellow servant fell to his knees and begged, 'Please, be patient with me! I'll pay you back!'

verses.kjv: And he would not: but went and cast him into prison, till he should pay the debt.
verses.web: He would not, but went and cast him into prison, until he should pay back that which was due.
verses.ct: But he refused. Instead, he had the man thrown into prison until the debt was paid in full.

verses.kjv: So when his fellowservants saw what was done, they were very sorry, and came and told unto their lord all that was done.
verses.web: So when his fellow servants saw what was done, they were exceedingly sorry, and came and told their lord all that was done.
verses.ct: When the other servants saw what happened, they were deeply upset. They went and reported the whole thing to the king.

verses.kjv: Then his lord, after that he had called him, said unto him, O thou wicked servant, I forgave thee all that debt, because thou desiredst me:
verses.web: Then his lord called him in, and said to him, ‘You wicked servant! I forgave you all that debt, because you begged me.
verses.ct: The king summoned the servant and said, 'You wicked servant! I forgave your entire debt because you begged me to.

verses.kjv: Shouldest not thou also have had compassion on thy fellowservant, even as I had pity on thee?
verses.web: Shouldn’t you also have had mercy on your fellow servant, even as I had mercy on you?’
verses.ct: Shouldn't you have shown mercy to your fellow servant, just as I showed mercy to you?'

verses.kjv: And his lord was wroth, and delivered him to the tormentors, till he should pay all that was due unto him.
verses.web: His lord was angry, and delivered him to the tormentors, until he should pay all that was due to him.
verses.ct: In his anger, the king handed him over to be tortured until he could pay back everything he owed.

verses.kjv: So likewise shall my heavenly Father do also unto you, if ye from your hearts forgive not every one his brother their trespasses.
verses.web: So my heavenly Father will also do to you, if you don’t each forgive your brother from your hearts for his misdeeds.”
verses.ct: My heavenly Father will treat each of you the same way if you don't forgive your brother from your heart."
